00059  /****************************************************************************\
00060  *      In this file, many general graph operations are provided.
00061  *      These functions can be used to implement graph algorithms.
00062  *
00063 \*===========================================================================*/
00064 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00065 #include <config.h>
00066 #include <stdio.h>
00067 #include <stdlib.h>
00068 #include <malloc.h>
00069 #include <library/graph.h>
00070 
00071 #define AUTO_REMOVE_MULTIPLE_ARCS
00072 
00073 static void
00074 Punt (char *mesg)
00075 {
00076   fprintf (stderr, "Error in graph: graph.c: %s\n", mesg);
00077   exit (1);
00078 }
00079 /*----------- node operations --------------------------*/
00080 static Node d_node_list = 0;
00081 /*
00082  *      Allocate space for a new node.
00083  */
00084 Node NewNode (void)
00085 {
00086   Node new_node;
00087   if (isNil (d_node_list))
00088     {
00089       new_node = (Node) malloc (sizeof (_Node));
00090       if (new_node == 0)
00091         Punt ("NewNode: cannot allocate space");
00092     }
00093   else
00094     {
00095       new_node = d_node_list;
00096       d_node_list = nextNode (new_node);
00097     }
00098   nodeId (new_node) = 0;
00099   nodeType (new_node) = 0;
00100   nodeStatus (new_node) = 0;
00101   nodeWeight (new_node) = 0.0;
00102   sourceArcs (new_node) = 0;
00103   destinationArcs (new_node) = 0;
00104   nextNode (new_node) = 0;
00105   nodeExt (new_node) = 0;
00106   return new_node;
00107 }
00108 /*
00109  *      Remove space for a node.
00110  */
00111 Node FreeNode (Node * node)
00112 {
00113   if ((node == 0) || ((*node) == 0))
00114     return 0;
00115   nextNode ((*node)) = d_node_list;
00116   d_node_list = *node;
00117   *node = 0;
00118   return 0;
00119 }
00120 /*----------- arc operations --------------------------*/
00121 static Arc d_arc_list = 0;
00122 /*
00123  *      Allocate space for a new arc.
00124  */
00125 Arc NewArc (void)
00126 {
00127   Arc new_arc;
00128   if (isNil (d_arc_list))
00129     {
00130       new_arc = (Arc) malloc (sizeof (_Arc));
00131       if (new_arc == 0)
00132         Punt ("NewArc: cannot allocate space");
00133     }
00134   else
00135     {
00136       new_arc = d_arc_list;
00137       d_arc_list = nextArc (new_arc);
00138     }
00139   arcType (new_arc) = 0;
00140   arcWeight (new_arc) = 0.0;
00141   sourceNode (new_arc) = 0;
00142   destinationNode (new_arc) = 0;
00143   nextArc (new_arc) = 0;
00144   arcExt (new_arc) = 0;
00145   return new_arc;
00146 }
00147 /*
00148  *      Remove space of an arc.
00149  */
00150 Arc FreeArc (Arc * arc)
00151 {
00152   if ((arc == 0) || ((*arc) == 0))
00153     return 0;
00154   nextArc ((*arc)) = d_arc_list;
00155   d_arc_list = *arc;
00156   *arc = 0;
00157   return 0;
00158 }
00159 /*----------- general operations --------------------------*/
00160 /*
00161  *      Connect two nodes by creating a new arc.
00162  *      It is an error to make a connection twice.
00163  *      A connection is uniquely specified by
00164  *      (src_node, dest_node, relation)
00165  */
00166 static int node_count;
00167 
00168 void
00169 ConnectNodes (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int relation)
00170 {
00171   Arc arc;
00172   if ((src_node == 0) || (dest_node == 0))
00173     Punt ("ConnectNodes: nil node");
00174   /*
00175    *  First make sure that there is no such connection.
00176    */
00177   for (arc = destinationArcs (src_node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00178     {
00179       if ((arcType (arc) == relation) && (destinationNode (arc) == dest_node))
00180 #ifdef AUTO_REMOVE_MULTIPLE_ARCS
00181         return;                 /* already exist */
00182 #else
00183         Punt ("ConnectNodes: multiple connections");
00184 #endif
00185     }
00186   arc = NewArc ();              /* create a new link for src_node */
00187   arcType (arc) = relation;
00188   sourceNode (arc) = src_node;
00189   destinationNode (arc) = dest_node;
00190   nextArc (arc) = destinationArcs (src_node);
00191   destinationArcs (src_node) = arc;
00192   arc = NewArc ();              /* create a new link for dest_node */
00193   arcType (arc) = relation;
00194   sourceNode (arc) = src_node;
00195   destinationNode (arc) = dest_node;
00196   nextArc (arc) = sourceArcs (dest_node);
00197   sourceArcs (dest_node) = arc;
00198   node_count++;
00199 }
00200 
00201 int
00202 PrintNodeCount ()
00203 {
00204   fprintf (stdout, "Total nodes connected : %d\n", node_count);
00205   node_count = 0;
00206   return (0);
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*
00210  *      Remove a connection.
00211  */
00212 void
00213 DisconnectNodes (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int relation)
00214 {
00215   Arc arc;
00216   /*
00217    *  First make sure that there is a such connection.
00218    */
00219   for (arc = destinationArcs (src_node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00220     {
00221       Node dest;
00222       dest = destinationNode (arc);
00223       if ((arcType (arc) == relation) && (dest == dest_node))
00224         break;
00225     }
00226   if (!isNil (arc))
00227     {
00228       Arc ptr;
00229       ptr = destinationArcs (src_node);
00230       if (ptr == arc)
00231         {                       /* remove the first link */
00232           destinationArcs (src_node) = nextArc (arc);
00233           nextArc (arc) = 0;
00234           FreeArc (&arc);
00235         }
00236       else
00237         {
00238           while (nextArc (ptr) != arc)
00239             ptr = nextArc (ptr);
00240           nextArc (ptr) = nextArc (arc);
00241           nextArc (arc) = 0;
00242           FreeArc (&arc);
00243         }
00244     }
00245   /*
00246    *  Now repeat for the dest_node.
00247    */
00248   for (arc = sourceArcs (dest_node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00249     {
00250       Node src;
00251       src = sourceNode (arc);
00252       if ((arcType (arc) == relation) && (src == src_node))
00253         break;
00254     }
00255   if (!isNil (arc))
00256     {
00257       Arc ptr;
00258       ptr = sourceArcs (dest_node);
00259       if (ptr == arc)
00260         {                       /* remove the first link */
00261           sourceArcs (dest_node) = nextArc (arc);
00262           nextArc (arc) = 0;
00263           FreeArc (&arc);
00264         }
00265       else
00266         {
00267           while (nextArc (ptr) != arc)
00268             ptr = nextArc (ptr);
00269           nextArc (ptr) = nextArc (arc);
00270           nextArc (arc) = 0;
00271           FreeArc (&arc);
00272         }
00273     }
00274 }
00275 /*
00276  *      Find the arc of the dest_node.
00277  */
00278 Arc FindSrcArc (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int type)
00279 {
00280   Arc ptr;
00281   for (ptr = sourceArcs (dest_node); ptr != 0; ptr = nextArc (ptr))
00282     {
00283       if (arcType (ptr) != type)
00284         continue;
00285       if (sourceNode (ptr) != src_node)
00286         continue;
00287       if (destinationNode (ptr) != dest_node)
00288         continue;
00289       break;
00290     }
00291   return ptr;
00292 }
00293 /*
00294  *      Find the arc of the src_node.
00295  */
00296 Arc FindDestArc (Node src_node, Node dest_node, int type)
00297 {
00298   Arc ptr;
00299   for (ptr = destinationArcs (src_node); ptr != 0; ptr = nextArc (ptr))
00300     {
00301       if (arcType (ptr) != type)
00302         continue;
00303       if (sourceNode (ptr) != src_node)
00304         continue;
00305       if (destinationNode (ptr) != dest_node)
00306         continue;
00307       break;
00308     }
00309   return ptr;
00310 }
00311 /*
00312  *      Delete a graph.
00313  */
00314 static Node nd_buf[MAX_GRAPH_SIZE];
00315 static int nd_buf_size = 0;
00316 static int
00317 _Add_2_nd_buf (Node node)
00318 {
00319   nd_buf[nd_buf_size++] = node;
00320   if (nd_buf_size >= MAX_GRAPH_SIZE)
00321     {
00322       Punt ("RemoveNodes: graph is too large");
00323       return (-1);
00324     }
00325   return (0);
00326 }
00327 void
00328 RemoveNodes (Node * node)
00329 {
00330   Node nd;
00331   int i;
00332   if ((node == 0) || ((*node) == 0))
00333     return;
00334   nd = *node;
00335   *node = 0;
00336   /*
00337    *  First place all reachable nodes in an array buffer.
00338    */
00339   nd_buf_size = 0;
00340   VisitAllNodes (nd, _Add_2_nd_buf);
00341   /*
00342    *  Return all space allocated.
00343    */
00344   for (i = 0; i < nd_buf_size; i++)
00345     {
00346       Arc arc, next;
00347       for (arc = sourceArcs (nd_buf[i]); !isNil (arc); arc = next)
00348         {
00349           next = nextArc (arc);
00350           FreeArc (&arc);
00351         }
00352       for (arc = destinationArcs (nd_buf[i]); !isNil (arc); arc = next)
00353         {
00354           next = nextArc (arc);
00355           FreeArc (&arc);
00356         }
00357       FreeNode (nd_buf + i);
00358     }
00359 }
00360 /*
00361  *      Set the (status) field of all nodes reachable from
00362  *      the formal parameter to 0.
00363  *      Returns the number of nodes marked.
00364  */
00365 int
00366 MarkNodesZero (Node node)
00367 {
00368   int i;
00369   /*
00370    *  Find all nodes that are reachable from (node).
00371    */
00372   nd_buf_size = 0;
00373   VisitAllNodes (node, _Add_2_nd_buf);
00374   for (i = 0; i < nd_buf_size; i++)
00375     {
00376       nodeStatus (nd_buf[i]) = 0;       /* set status to 0 */
00377     }
00378   return nd_buf_size;
00379 }
00380 /*
00381  *      For all reachable nodes from the formal parameter,
00382  *      if the (status) field is not masked [status&~mask]
00383  *      set the status field to [mark]
00384  *      Returns the number of nodes marked.
00385  */
00386 int
00387 MarkNodes (Node node, int mask, int mark)
00388 {
00389   int i, n;
00390   /*
00391    *  It is an error that mark overlaps with the RESERVED_BITS.
00392    */
00393   if (mark & RESERVED_STATUS_BITS)
00394     Punt ("MarkNodes: illegal mark");
00395   /*
00396    *  Find all nodes that are reachable from (node).
00397    */
00398   nd_buf_size = 0;
00399   VisitAllNodes (node, _Add_2_nd_buf);
00400   n = 0;
00401   for (i = 0; i < nd_buf_size; i++)
00402     {
00403       if ((nodeStatus (nd_buf[i]) & ~mask) != 0)
00404         {
00405           nodeStatus (nd_buf[i]) = mark;
00406           n++;
00407         }
00408     }
00409   return n;
00410 }
00411 /*
00412  *      For all reachable nodes from the formal parameter,
00413  *      if [status==mark] then apply fn() on the node, and then
00414  *      set the [status] field to 0.
00415  *      fn() is expected to return 0.
00416  *      Returns the number of nodes, for which fn() is invoked.
00417  */
00418 int
00419 VisitNodes (Node node, int mark, int (*fn) (Node))
00420 {
00421   int i, n, code;
00422   /*
00423    *  Find all nodes that are reachable from (node).
00424    */
00425   nd_buf_size = 0;
00426   VisitAllNodes (node, _Add_2_nd_buf);
00427   n = 0;
00428   code = 0;
00429   for (i = 0; i < nd_buf_size; i++)
00430     {
00431       if (nodeStatus (nd_buf[i]) == mark)
00432         {
00433           code |= (*fn) (nd_buf[i]);
00434           n++;
00435         }
00436     }
00437   if (code != 0)
00438     return -1;
00439   return n;
00440 }
00441 /*
00442  *      For all reachable nodes from the formal parameter,
00443  *      apply fn(). fn() is expected to return 0.
00444  *      The number of nodes, for which fn() is invoked
00445  *      is returned. set the [status] field to 0.
00446  *
00447  *      !!! This function must work all by itself. It must also
00448  *      be extremely efficient.
00449  *      The RESERVED_STATUS_BITS can be used to mark all nodes
00450  *      that have been reached.
00451  *
00452  *      When this function is called, it is assumed that the
00453  *      RESERVED_STATUS_BITS of (node) are not set.
00454  *      If the RESERVED_STATUS_BITS are set, the node is
00455  *      considered to be visited, and will not be visited again.
00456  */
00457 static int
00458 MarkStatusBits (Node node)
00459 {
00460   int n;
00461   Arc arc;
00462   if (node == 0)
00463     return 0;
00464   if ((nodeStatus (node) & RESERVED_STATUS_BITS) != 0)
00465     return 0;                   /* already visited */
00466   nodeStatus (node) |= RESERVED_STATUS_BITS;
00467   n = 1;
00468   for (arc = destinationArcs (node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00469     {
00470       n += MarkStatusBits (destinationNode (arc));
00471     }
00472   return n;
00473 }
00474 static int
00475 ClearStatusBits (Node node, int (*fn) (Node))
00476 {
00477   int code;
00478   Arc arc;
00479   if (node == 0)
00480     return 0;
00481   /*
00482    *  Ignore, nodes whose RESERVED_STATUS_BITS are not set.
00483    */
00484   if ((nodeStatus (node) & RESERVED_STATUS_BITS) == 0)
00485     return 0;                   /* already visited */
00486   nodeStatus (node) &= ~RESERVED_STATUS_BITS;   /* clear bits */
00487   code = (*fn) (node);          /* invoke the function */
00488   for (arc = destinationArcs (node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00489     {
00490       Node dest;
00491       dest = destinationNode (arc);
00492       if ((nodeStatus (dest) & RESERVED_STATUS_BITS) != 0)
00493         code |= ClearStatusBits (dest, fn);
00494     }
00495   return code;
00496 }
00497 int
00498 VisitAllNodes (Node node, int (*fn) (Node))
00499 {
00500   int size;
00501   /*
00502    *  Visit all nodes whose RESERVED_STATUS_BITS are 0, and
00503    *  are reachable from (node).
00504    */
00505   size = MarkStatusBits (node);
00506   /*
00507    *  Clear all RESERVED_STATUS_BITS.
00508    *  Execute the requested function.
00509    */
00510   if (ClearStatusBits (node, fn) != 0)
00511     return -1;                  /* error */
00512   return size;
00513 }
00514 /*
00515  *      Returns 1 if the graph is not an empty graph, and
00516  *      it is cyclic. Returns 0 if the graph is empty.
00517  *      Returns -1 if the graph is acyclic.
00518  *      The (status) field is set to all 1's if there
00519  *      is no cycle. The last node of a cycle is set to 2.
00520  */
00521 static int
00522 FindNonZero (Node node)
00523 {
00524   int cycle;
00525   Arc arc;
00526   if (node == 0)
00527     return 0;
00528   if (nodeStatus (node) != 0)
00529     {                           /* found a cycle */
00530       return 1;
00531     }
00532   cycle = 0;
00533   nodeStatus (node) = 1;
00534   for (arc = destinationArcs (node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00535     {
00536       Node dest;
00537       dest = destinationNode (arc);
00538       if (nodeStatus (dest) != 0)
00539         {
00540           nodeStatus (node) = 2;        /* last node of a cycle */
00541           cycle = 1;
00542         }
00543       else
00544         {
00545           cycle |= FindNonZero (dest);
00546         }
00547     }
00548   return (cycle != 0);
00549 }
00550 int
00551 IsCyclic (Node node)
00552 {
00553   MarkNodesZero (node);         /* mark all status bits to 0 */
00554   return FindNonZero (node);
00555 }
00556 /*---------------------------------------------------------*/
00557 static FGraph d_graph_list = 0;
00558 /*
00559  *      Allocate space for a graph.
00560  */
00561 FGraph NewGraph (void)
00562 {
00563   FGraph new_graph;
00564   if (isNil (d_graph_list))
00565     {
00566       new_graph = (FGraph) malloc (sizeof (_FGraph));
00567       if (new_graph == 0)
00568         Punt ("NewGraph: cannot allocate space");
00569     }
00570   else
00571     {
00572       new_graph = d_graph_list;
00573       d_graph_list = new_graph->next;
00574     }
00575   new_graph->root = 0;
00576   new_graph->nodes = 0;
00577   new_graph->next = 0;
00578   new_graph->extension = 0;
00579   return new_graph;
00580 }
00581 FGraph FreeGraph (FGraph * graph)
00582 {
00583   Node *nodes;
00584   if ((graph == 0) || ((*graph) == 0))
00585     return 0;
00586   nodes = &((*graph)->nodes);
00587   if ((*nodes) != 0)
00588     {
00589       RemoveNodes (nodes);
00590     }
00591   (*graph)->next = d_graph_list;
00592   d_graph_list = *graph;
00593   *graph = 0;
00594   return 0;
00595 }
00596 /*
00597  *      Add a node into a graph structure.
00598  *      Must preserve the sequential order.
00599  *      So it is inserted at the end of the list.
00600  */
00601 void
00602 AddNode (FGraph graph, Node node)
00603 {
00604   Node ptr;
00605   if ((graph == 0) || (node == 0))
00606     return;
00607   ptr = graph->nodes;
00608   if (ptr == 0)
00609     {
00610       graph->nodes = node;
00611     }
00612   else
00613     {
00614       while (nextNode (ptr) != 0)
00615         ptr = nextNode (ptr);
00616       nextNode (ptr) = node;
00617     }
00618 }
00619 /*
00620  *      Find a node in a graph.
00621  *      If not found, return 0.
00622  */
00623 Node FindNode (FGraph graph, int node_id)
00624 {
00625   Node ptr;
00626   for (ptr = graph->nodes; ptr != 0; ptr = nextNode (ptr))
00627     {
00628       if (nodeId (ptr) == node_id)
00629         break;
00630     }
00631   return ptr;
00632 }
00633 Node DeleteNode (FGraph graph, int node_id)
00634 {
00635   Node target, ptr;
00636   target = FindNode (graph, node_id);
00637   if (target == 0)
00638     return 0;
00639   if (graph->nodes == target)
00640     {
00641       graph->nodes = nextNode (target);
00642       nextNode (target) = 0;
00643     }
00644   else
00645     {
00646       for (ptr = graph->nodes; nextNode (ptr) != target;
00647            ptr = nextNode (ptr));
00648       nextNode (ptr) = nextNode (target);
00649       nextNode (target) = 0;
00650     }
00651   return target;
00652 }
00653 /*---------------------------------------------------------*/
00654 
00655 #ifdef DEBUG_G
00656 PrintNode (node)
00657      Node node;
00658 {
00659   Arc arc;
00660   printf ("node (id=%d) (status=%d) \n", nodeId (node), nodeStatus (node));
00661   printf ("  (source =");
00662   for (arc = sourceArcs (node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00663     {
00664       printf (" %d", arc->source->id);
00665     }
00666   printf (")\n");
00667   printf ("  (destination =");
00668   for (arc = destinationArcs (node); !isNil (arc); arc = nextArc (arc))
00669     {
00670       printf (" %d", arc->destination->id);
00671     }
00672   printf (")\n");
00673   return 0;
00674 }
00675 PrintGraph (root)
00676      Node root;
00677 {
00678   int n;
00679   n = VisitAllNodes (root, PrintNode);
00680   printf ("> total %d nodes printed\n\n", n);
00681 }
00682 main ()
00683 {
00684   int i;
00685   Node graph;
00686   Node node1, node2;
00687   Arc arc1, arc2;
00691   graph = NewNode ();
00692   graph->id = 0;
00693   for (i = 1; i < 5; i++)
00694     {
00695       node1 = NewNode ();
00696       node1->id = i;
00697       ConnectNodes (graph, node1, i);
00698       ConnectNodes (node1, graph, i);
00699     }
00700   printf ("> is cyclic? = %d\n", IsCyclic (graph));
00701   PrintGraph (graph);
00702 
00703   RemoveNodes (&graph);         /* 0 */
00704   printf ("> is cyclic? = %d\n", IsCyclic (graph));
00705   PrintGraph (graph);
00706 
00707   graph = NewNode ();
00708   graph->id = 0;
00709   for (i = 1; i < 5; i++)
00710     {
00711       node1 = NewNode ();
00712       node1->id = i;
00713       node2 = NewNode ();
00714       node2->id = -i;
00715       ConnectNodes (graph, node1, i);
00716       ConnectNodes (node1, node2, i);
00717     }
00718   printf ("> is cyclic? = %d\n", IsCyclic (graph));
00719   PrintGraph (graph);
00720 
00721   DisconnectNodes (graph, node1, i - 1);
00722   printf ("> is cyclic? = %d\n", IsCyclic (graph));
00723   PrintGraph (graph);
00724   /*
00725    *      Test MarkNodesZero(), MarkNodes(), VisitNodes()
00726    */
00727   MarkNodesZero (graph);
00728   PrintGraph (graph);
00729 
00730   graph = NewNode ();
00731   graph->id = 0;
00732   graph->status = 0;
00733   for (i = 1; i < 5; i++)
00734     {
00735       node1 = NewNode ();
00736       node1->id = i;
00737       node1->status = i;
00738       node2 = NewNode ();
00739       node2->id = -i;
00740       node2->status = i;
00741       ConnectNodes (graph, node1, i);
00742       ConnectNodes (node1, node2, i);
00743       ConnectNodes (node1, graph, i);
00744     }
00745   PrintGraph (graph);
00746 
00747   MarkNodes (graph, 3, 100);
00748   PrintGraph (graph);
00749 
00750   VisitNodes (graph, 3, PrintGraph);
00751 }
